gtopinionminer

Class OpinionMiner

  • java.lang.Object
    • gtopinionminer.OpinionMiner

  • public class OpinionMiner
extends java.lang.Object

    The main class of the Opinion Miner Tool for German Tweets

    This tool was build as a student project during Fall School in Computational Linguistics 2015 at Uni Trier, Germany. It is capable of determining a sentiment for German-speaking tweets as a score in the range [-1, 1] (negative to positive), for which it exploits the so called lexicon approach. In particular, 2 sentiment dictionaries are used.

    Since:
    September 25, 2015
    See Also:

    ATTENTION: REQUIRES WORKING INTERNET CONNECTION

      • OpinionMiner

        public OpinionMiner(java.lang.String tweetSet,
                    java.lang.String keywordSet)
        Create an OpinionMiner object to run the tool. Provide a list of tweets you want to mine and a list of keywords you want to determine the sentiment for.
        Parameters:
        tweetSet - .tsv file containing tweet-id \t tweet text in German to be analysed
        keywordSet - .tsv file listing keywords of interest

    • Method Detail

      • initTools

        private void initTools()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the Stanford tokenizer and the Mate lemmatizer for tweet preprocessing.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong e.g. with loading models
        See Also:
        A Suite of Stanford Core NLP Tools, Mate tools

      • offsetToKeyword2weight

        private static double offsetToKeyword2weight(int offset)
        Maps the offset of a relevant lemma to a keyword to a weight suitable for use in LemmaList.calculateSentiment().
        Parameters:
        offset - the (signed) offset of the lemma to the keyword (negative when it's positioned before to the keyword, positive otherwise). Should be between -#WINDOW_SIZE_RELEVANT and +#WINDOW_SIZE_RELEVANT for useful results.
        Returns:
        the influence of this lemma on the sentiment score the with respect to the distance (i.e. Math.abs(int)) to the keyword, a weight between 0 (for maximum distance) and 1 (for offset 0).

      • processTweets

        private void processTweets(Tweet tweet)
        Parameters:
        tweet - tweet to process

        Each encountered tweet is preprocessed, including tokenization, lemmatization and stopword removal. Only tweets that contain keywords are further selected, with the tokens surrounding the found keyword k within the window of size 4 being put into a LemmaList.

        After that each LemmaList is processed by calling its member method, whereby the sentiment score for the keyword k is computed.

        Finnaly, the sentiment is averaged per tweet.

        See Also:
        Tweet, LemmaList, LemmaList.calculateSentiment(), Tweet.calculateAvgSentiment()

      • printStats

        public void printStats()
        Outputs information about relevant tweets with their sentiment scores to stout.
